class.name: wxStatusBar
class.description: A status bar is a narrow window that can be placed along the bottom of a frame to give small amounts of status information.

flag.name: wxSTB_SIZEGRIP
flag.description: Displays a gripper at the right-hand side of the status bar which can be used to resize the parent window.

flag.name: wxSTB_SHOW_TIPS
flag.description: Displays tooltips for those panes whose status text has been ellipsized/truncated because the status text doesn't fit the pane width. Note that this flag has effect only on wxGTK (with GTK+ >= 2.12) currently.

flag.name: wxSTB_ELLIPSIZE_START
flag.description: Replace the beginning of the status texts with an ellipsis when the status text widths exceed the status bar pane's widths (uses wxControl::Ellipsize).

flag.name: wxSTB_ELLIPSIZE_MIDDLE
flag.description: Replace the middle of the status texts with an ellipsis when the status text widths exceed the status bar pane's widths (uses wxControl::Ellipsize).

flag.name: wxSTB_ELLIPSIZE_END
flag.description: Replace the end of the status texts with an ellipsis when the status text widths exceed the status bar pane's widths (uses wxControl::Ellipsize).

string.name: widths
string.description: Comma-separated list of fields integers. Each value specifies width of one field; the values are interpreted using the same convention used by wxStatusBar::SetStatusWidths().

string.name: styles
string.description: Comma-separated list of fields flags. Each value specifies status bar field flag and can be one of wxSB_NORMAL, wxSB_FLAT or wxSB_RAISED. See wxStatusBar::SetStatusStyles() for their description.
